question: Which international organisation has decided to hold a meeting on December 1, 2020 to commemorate victims of World War II?
explanation:
The United Nations General Assembly (UNGA) has decided to hold a meeting on December 1, 2020 to commemorate all victims of World War II. The resolution in this regard was drafted by Russia and has been adopted based on a voting.
Second World War, was a global war that lasted from 1939 to 1945. It involved the vast majority of the world's countries forming two opposing military alliances namely the Allies and the Axis.
